noSmallerThan

public static int noSmallerThan(int n,
                                int margin)
Avoid a number smaller than a certain number

Parameters:
n - The number to be checked
margin - The margin of the number. n cannot be smaller than this
Returns:
If n is smaller than margin, return margin, otherwise return n

inRange

public static int inRange(int n,
                          int lo,
                          int hi)
Avoid a number getting out of a certain range

Parameters:
n - The number to be checked
lo - The Lower margin of the number. n cannot be smaller than this
hi - The Upper margin of the number. n cannot be bigger than this
Returns:
If n is out of range, set to defined extreme values, otherwise return n

public static boolean hpRatioTest(double ratio,
                                  Player p)
Test whether the HP of a player is below a certain percentage of its initial

Parameters:
ratio - The percentage, a real number from 0 to 100 (or above, actually... in some cases it is meaningful)
p - The player object
Returns:
Whether the player has its HP below a percentage of its initial

intSubset

public static int[] intSubset(int n,
                              int k)
Select a subset of k numbers from 0 to n-1. It is guaranteed that it is equally likely to generate all subsets, and the returned list is sorted

Parameters:
n - Number of elements to choose
k - Number of elements to be chosen into the subset
Returns:
Integer array containing the subset.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If n < k or n < 0 or k < 0

invertArray

public static int[] invertArray(int[] a,
                                int top)
Invert an array. That is, {1, 3, 5} is changed to {0, 2, 4, 6, 7} if top = 8.

Parameters:
a - Array to invert
top - The top value - that is, the maximum value of the array, exclusive. The minimum is always 0.
Returns:
Inverted array

colorCode

public static java.lang.String colorCode(int r,
                                         int g,
                                         int b)
Convert a color with its RGB value to HTML ready code

Parameters:
r - Red component of color, in range 0 to 255
g - Green component of color, in range 0 to 255
b - Blue component of color, in range 0 to 255
Returns:
String of color which is HTML ready

colorText

public static java.lang.String colorText(int v,
                                         int vlo,
                                         int vhi,
                                         int rlo,
                                         int glo,
                                         int blo,
                                         int rhi,
                                         int ghi,
                                         int bhi)
Color a text using BBCode such that the color either increase or decrease one value to other value for each component of the color A gradient would be produced from vlo to vhi, as v varies.

Parameters:
v - The value to be shown. Between vlo and vhi. Extreme value taken if it is out of range vlo or vhi.
vlo - The Lower bound of value
vhi - The Upper bound of value
rlo - The value of red component when v is at its lower bound, in range 0 to 255
rhi - The value of red component when v is at its upper bound, in range 0 to 255
glo - The value of green component when v is at its lower bound, in range 0 to 255
ghi - The value of green component when v is at its upper bound, in range 0 to 255
blo - The value of blue component when v is at its lower bound, in range 0 to 255
bhi - The value of blue component when v is at its upper bound, in range 0 to 255
Returns:
BBCoded string showing the text in generated color
